asset.name: EDG-7500
asset.one_liner: First-in-class cardiac sarcomere modulator for HCM that slows acto-myosin engagement without inactivating myosin, avoiding the LVEF reductions seen with cardiac myosin inhibitors

target.name: Cardiac Sarcomere (Acto-Myosin)
target.pathway: Acto-myosin cross-bridge cycling → cardiac contraction → hypercontractility in HCM

biology.simple_explanation: EDG-7500 is a first-in-class selective cardiac sarcomere modulator designed to slow the rate of myocardial force generation in early systole and accelerate actin-myosin cross-bridge detachment in early diastole to improve ventricular filling. Unlike cardiac myosin inhibitors (CMIs) which stabilize the super-relaxed state by inactivating myosin, EDG-7500 preserves cardiac myosin function and does not affect myosin-actin proximity or cross-bridge reattachment rates.

mechanism_vs_cmi.cmi_mechanism: Selectively inhibit cardiac myosin ATPase activity to stabilize super-relaxed (SRX) state, decreasing myosin-actin cross-bridge formation
mechanism_vs_cmi.edg7500_mechanism: Slows rate of acto-myosin engagement and speeds disengagement WITHOUT inactivating myosin motor head
mechanism_vs_cmi.key_difference: CMIs can cause unpredictable LVEF reduction; EDG-7500 designed to preserve LVEF

why_good_target.clinical_validation: Sarcomere modulation validated by mavacamten (CAMZYOS) and aficamten approval in oHCM
unmet_need: CMIs cause unpredictable LVEF reduction requiring frequent echocardiogram monitoring
Mavacamten requires REMS program in US with echos every 4-12 weeks
Up to 13.8% of patients on mavacamten develop LVEF <50%
Nonobstructive HCM (2/3 of patients) has NO approved therapies
Current therapies (beta-blockers, CCBs, disopyramide) do not modify disease

hcm_overview.definition: Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM) is characterized by enhanced cardiac actin-myosin cross-bridge cycling, leading to hypercontractility, myocardial hypertrophy, fibrosis, and diastolic dysfunction
hcm_overview.prevalence: Most common inherited cardiac condition; ~1 in 500 people
hcm_overview.genetics: Traditionally considered monogenic but polygenic component increasingly recognized

ohcm_phenotype.definition: Obstructive HCM - combination of hypercontractility, hypertrophy, small LV cavity, and abnormal mitral valve apparatus leading to LVOT obstruction
ohcm_phenotype.pathophysiology: LVOT gradient ≥30 mmHg at rest or ≥50 mmHg with provocation
ohcm_phenotype.symptoms: Dyspnea, chest pain, syncope, exercise intolerance, heart failure

nhcm_phenotype.definition: Nonobstructive HCM - ventricular hypertrophy without significant LVOT obstruction
nhcm_phenotype.pathophysiology: Diastolic dysfunction, impaired filling, elevated filling pressures

first_line_therapy.mechanism: Decrease calcium entry, reduce heart rate, prolong diastolic filling
first_line_therapy.efficacy: Variable LVOT reduction; substantial proportion are non-responders
first_line_therapy.evidence: No adequately powered RCTs; based on long-standing clinical use and expert consensus
first_line_therapy.limitations: Do not modify disease; inconsistent efficacy

second_line_therapy.mechanism: Inhibit L-type calcium channels, negative inotropy, prolong diastolic filling

third_line_therapy.mechanism: Sodium channel blocker with negative inotropic effects; inhibits peak/late sodium currents, L-type calcium currents, and RyRs

cardiac_myosin_inhibitors.class_overview: First drug class designed to directly target underlying pathophysiology of HCM; only HCM therapy with data from multiple placebo-controlled Phase III trials
cardiac_myosin_inhibitors.mechanism: Selectively inhibit cardiac myosin ATPase activity to stabilize super-relaxed (SRX) state, decreasing excessive myosin-actin cross-bridge formation

mavacamten.approval: FDA approved for symptomatic oHCM (NYHA Class II-III)
mavacamten.efficacy_explorer: Improved exercise capacity, reduced LVOT gradient, alleviated symptoms
mavacamten.efficacy_valor: Reduced need for septal reduction therapy in most patients
mavacamten.remodeling: Favorable LV remodeling - improved LV mass index, max wall thickness, LA volume index
mavacamten.safety_lvef_reduction: 5.6% in EXPLORER-HCM; 8.7% in OLE; up to 13.8% in VALOR-HCM
mavacamten.safety_severe_lvef: 2 patients with LVEF <30% and 1 death in VALOR-HCM
mavacamten.rems_required: Yes - echo every 4 weeks initially, every 12 weeks once stable

aficamten.differentiators: Shorter half-life (3.4 days), no significant drug-drug interactions
aficamten.efficacy: pVO2 improvement +1.74 ml/kg/min; >95% clinically meaningful improvement

invasive_therapies.surgical_myectomy: Preferred for surgical candidates; can address multiple pathologies; <2% mortality at high-volume centers
invasive_therapies.alcohol_septal_ablation: For non-surgical candidates; limited by coronary anatomy; up to 20% pacemaker dependence

edg7500_differentiation.vs_cmi_mechanism: Slows acto-myosin engagement WITHOUT inactivating myosin (CMIs inactivate myosin to stabilize SRX state)
edg7500_differentiation.vs_cmi_lvef: No meaningful LVEF reductions observed across development program
edg7500_differentiation.vs_cmi_monitoring: May not require REMS or frequent safety echocardiograms
edg7500_differentiation.vs_cmi_indications: Active in both oHCM AND nHCM (CMIs only approved for oHCM)
edg7500_differentiation.preclinical_findings: LVEF >50% maintained even at highest exposures in animal models
edg7500_differentiation.phase_1_findings: Well tolerated in healthy volunteers; no LVEF <50% even above therapeutic exposure; half-life ~30 hours

trial_design.design: Multicenter open-label study of safety, tolerability, PK, and PD

safety.lvef_key_finding: No LVEF <50% across broad exposure range
safety.lvef_nhcm_low_baseline: 4 patients with baseline <60% all remained stable (+2.5% change)

catalysts.event: Longer-term CIRRUS-HCM data with dose optimization
catalysts.what_to_watch: Durability; continued LVEF safety; optimal dosing
Trial design for oHCM and/or nHCM

competitors.limitation: REMS required; LVEF <50% up to 13.8%; $89,500/year; oHCM only
LVEF <50% in 5.3%; oHCM only; will likely need monitoring

our_advantages: No meaningful LVEF reductions - may eliminate need for REMS/frequent echos
Active in BOTH oHCM AND nHCM (2/3 of HCM has no approved treatments)

investment_analysis.probability_of_success: De-risked by Phase 2; larger trials needed

market_opportunity.unmet_need: nHCM has NO approved therapies; oHCM therapies have significant monitoring burden
